Summary: 3 bright yellowish-white lights flew overhead and joined 6 additional lights and bolted out of sight.
trends: There have been 2 other sightings in Camp Hill
There were no other sightings in Camp Hill on or around October 17th 2008
divs: sighting detailson 10\17\2008, i was leaving a high school football game (steel-high @ trinity in shiremanstown, pa.) around 9:15 or before 9:30pm. i was walking to my car with three adults (wife, son & cousin) along with two of my grandchildren (ages 2 and 5 at this time). walking near us were other groups of people who also were walking to their vehicles. there were patches of clouds in the sky that somewhat resembled an old ripped-torn blanket. the moon was slightly to the right from the direction we were walking. the moon was pretty bright and was more than 3\4 full. as we were walking, my eyes picked up on three rapidly moving lights in the sky. at this moment they were slightly to the lower right side of the moon and was moving slightly closer in our direction but still in moving in a direction that they stayed a good distance above and in front of us. i honestly could not give you an estimate of their altitude, but i do know they had to be higher than the clouds because they were also transparent behind the clouds, and as they traveled in clearer parts of the sky. a few moments after first seeing them, i immediately called out to my group "look at these lights in the sky!!!". but, as i was watching them move away from us, i, somewhat in an embarrassing way, said "oh, it's not what i thought it was". but as i continued to watch them move further away and almost out of sight, two sets of three lights (6 total plus the initial 3), swooped down from opposite directions and lined up on each side of the initial three lights (totaling 9). they appeared to have slowed down as they lined up, side by side, and suddenly, they bolted away at an incredibly high rate of speed and disappeared from sight. i've never seen anything move as fast as these objects and when they were nearest to me, i could not hear them. also, they continued to elevate as they disappeared from site. when the others sets of lights came into view, i excitedly yelled to my group "oh my gosh! did you see that? what was that? i can't believe i just saw what i saw!! my wife was less than 10' in front of me and she had our two grand children on each side of her, and, my son and his cousin was probably two steps or 10' ahead of my wife. from my point of view, it appeared they also was witnessing what i was seeing, and hearing all of what i was saying from the point of me initially embarrassing myself telling them to look at these lights in the sky. but as i continued to excitedly ask them what this was, my wife faced me and asked what i was talking about. my son and his cousin also did not hear me. the other groups of people who were walk- ing near us did not speak up or acknowledge any of my conversation, and some were probably five to seven yards near me. there was noise in the background, the game was just ending, people cheering and talking pretty loud, the band was playing and the loudspeaker was still in operation - even though we were now a good distance away from the stadium. also, these lights had a bright yellowish-white color to them. i initially tried to convince myself these three lights were just spotlights in the sky, only, these lights did not have a beam of light emanating from the ground to them and they also seemed to be traveling independently - not fixed or attached to each other, even though they kept their distance, like in formation with each other. it was the most incredible light show i have ever seen... when i arrived home around 10:35 or before 10:45pm, i called the local abc, cbs, fox & nbc television stations hoping there were reports of strange lights in the sky, and there were none. i also called the local airport (harris- burg international airport), and they had no reports. even though i didn't get validation that this occurred, i know what i saw, and there is no con- vincing me otherwise.... i'm willing to submit to a lie detector test to validate all of what i have just said here in writing.
